climbs.name: Leviticus
climbs.fa: FA, Kevin Brown. FFA, Steve Edwards

content.description:
This route sees few ascents, partly because it sits all by its lonesome in an off-beat location, and partly because it is absurdly hard. Leviticus isn't THE most difficult climb on the central coast from a grade perspective, but it is certainly one of the most technically challenging. At 5.12d, it doesn't give an inch, and touts one of the more memorableand painfulcruxes for miles in all directions. If you can link through the bottom three bolts of this vicious and powerful line, you will likely have some shredded skin on at least one of your digits. And then the pump starts...

Without giving too much away, here's the breakdown:

1) tie in, get nervous

2) perform a stupid hard finger-lock boulder problem (V7 or V8)

3) Grunt in pain

4) Transition in to lie-back section of route

5) Don't get tired before you get to the anchors
content.location: Steep face on right side of creek before you get to the actual Seven Falls area (for those not "in-the-know", I'm talking about the swimming holes). The overhanging crack is unmistakable.

content.description:
Solid hand jams narrow to fingers then widen again on a slightly overhanging left leaning crack. After this section a significantly easier finger crack leads to the top where there is a slung tree and rap ring(placed 2009).

This is not in the Edwards guide book as far as I can tell. I thought is was trial by faith but it is not.
content.protection: Gear to 3" and a couple finger sized pieces for the upper bit.
content.location: Hike past the chipped steps at the pools where hikers hang out. Approximately 200 yards further look up the right side of the canyon. The start of the route is about 200' up the right slope of the canyon.

content.description: A gently overhanging hand and and fist crack in a right facing corner.  Offers some fun jamming for its short stature, and is easily soloable. This route starts behind a tree approximately 20 feet right of the unmistakable overhanging thin crack Leviticus 5.12d.
content.protection: A few pieces to 3", tie off some stout bushes for an anchor. Walkoff the backside to climbers right.
